parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  It discusses investigations and the power of media during electoral campaigns in a general sense, mentioning journalists from the Republic of Moldova.  There is no mention of any specific Romanian candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content is presented in a way that aims to reach a broad audience interested in media investigations and electoral processes. The use of hashtags like #laboratoruldeeducatiemedia and #podcastcji further suggests a wider reach beyond personal communication.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post appears to be promoting a podcast episode discussing media investigations during electoral campaigns. While the topic is related to elections, the content itself does not directly advocate for or against any particular candidate or party. The focus is on the role of journalism and media during elections, not on influencing voter behavior.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post promotes a podcast episode discussing journalistic investigations and cooperation between journalists. This aligns with journalistic activities aimed at informing the public about important issues, including those related to elections. The content does not appear to cross the line into propaganda by overtly endorsing or opposing any candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions; it promotes a journalistic piece.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1631426287811146</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a podcast episode discussing media investigations during electoral campaigns. While the topic is related to the electoral process, the content does not directly advocate for or against any specific candidate or party. The post's primary objective is to promote the podcast, not to influence the vote.  The content is presented in a journalistic style, focusing on the role of media in elections rather than directly influencing voter behavior.  The lack of any specific mention of candidates or parties, combined with the journalistic nature of the promoted content, suggests that it does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>CJI</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
